ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I feel comfortable in the presence of strangers.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree ; 2= Disagree ; 3= Mildly Disagree ; 4= Mildly Agree ; 5= Agree ; 6= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Total of Social Connectedness Scale Revised items
I am unable to connect with others.
Notes: 1=Strongly disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Slightly disagree; 4=Slightly agree; 5=Agree; 6= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Reverse coding of item 1
Reverse coding of item 3
Reverse coding of item 6
Reverse coding of item 7
Sum of reverse coded items
Total score
Notes: Sum items 2 + 4 + 5 + reversecode_sum. Higher scores = Greater social connectedness
